5rl3Tm4Ambe9-zTNAyjVbg.text: My husband and I were wandering looking for somewhere to eat and came upon Zara's. I am so glad we did. After two weeks of heavier foods, this was more than needed. We are leaving stuffed with delicious, fresh made hummus, perfectly grilled and dressed halloumi and two lunch wraps. My husband and had the lamb wrap and I had the falafel. Both were delicious. I loved both, but since I was in the mood for something vegetarian, the falafel, roasted eggplant, roasted red pepper and hummus wrap was perfection. I can't believe this is a 5 takeaway option - I would be here every day!

a-PVpGEWe5ay6vWwL0rvGQ.text: I found the service and food to be excellent. They had plenty of gluten free offerings for me and were knowledgeable about issues around cross contamination.

0khtWYkLpDxyAjKpJk4fQQ.text: This is our second time eating here on 2 separate trips exactly 1 year apart. He food and service is fantastic. Both times we had the meze banquet tailored for a vegan diner and a nut and gluten free diner. Last year we were here for lunch and this year for dinner. The meals were similar but with enough variation to be different. Dinner with 2 drinks was just about 45.

gFwi6WiAJxe0XuFNh6Qn8g.text: Wandered in. Ordered multiple small plates. Fantastic! Bread, prawns, stuffed mushrooms and beef were excellent. The calamari was ok.  Dipped bread in the butter prawn juice after finishing the prawns. Excellent. Australian Shiraz was good.   Will return. Best meal I've had in the UK so far on this trip.

IgMgYOMUaXwkxSGcAzjAYQ.text: This place is just amazing the seafood casserole special is a must whenever available. The angus burgers are just perfectly cooked and juice. The fish and chips is crispy and juice. Highly recommend you give this place a try we loved it!!!!!

ybP5dCy4ySonefA8q-8ZRA.text: We ordered a few appetizers instead of a main course. Plenty for us. Artichoke hearts - good. Prawns - so so. Lively atmosphere. Okay for a friendly meal and prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sign at entrance

RPaWalbJcFNs3tjKrsHE-Q.text: Delicious tzatziki and very accommodating staff (was able to substitute bread for cucumber) I will stop here EVERY time I visit Edinburgh.

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Tzatziki with cucumber for dipping.

GlEHtxtzoqs6g1XujZeFTQ.text: Staff was too stressed !! Food was decent good taste. Staff needs a bit more training on service but it looks like new staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

1kr1DCu0kI0Z7zUDk1X1Jw.text: This small bistro in the heart of Edinburgh was just the thing our group needed after a long day of site seeing. The restaurant is pretty small, but there was enough seeing for our large group of 11. The staff was a extremely accommodating and helped us immensely. The food itself was super flavor-able, fresh and reasonably priced. I would highly recommend stopping by!

n01Sj3OsMJPQQEvyoZY9KQ.text: We have been a few times and the food is always delicious. The staff are excellent. The humus, mixed olives and bread were a perfect starter shared between 4 of us. Can't wait to go back again.

xmNWzy7A9rIbFjFbDLcigw.text: Sat, dec 9 - they turned away a family with an 8 year old because there are no children allowed in the restaurant. They kept saying 7 mins per wait even though it was clear this was not True. Food was mediocre at best. Stern service. Wouldn't recommend or come back!

A-VBbnt0U3hxvRr4ZgGjjg.text: This place is a great find if you enjoy Mediterranean food! I ordered the vine leaves and the hummus.   I didn't enjoy the vine leaves, but I had never had them before so I didn't have anything to compare it too. The hummus was absolutely delicious though and they brought out warm fresh pita bread to dip with. I would go again!

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Other part of menu
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The vine leaves
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. The hummus that also comes with pita bread

hBSRyWENqkOocvKSxIlsTQ.text: So yummy and fun little find. The gentleman was so sweet and helpful...a gem.Love wandering, getting lost and discovering

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

pfEMG2Tu405w8cz_zC1nrQ.text: This place was perfect. It was warm and welcoming. The service was attentive and informative. The smells are a beautiful and tantalizing precursor to the food. The flavors were complex and just delish. We had the hummus, red pepper dip, artichoke, falafel, Moroccan meatballs, chicken wings, tatezki, lamb cutlets. Our entire family was happy, which is challenging with two vegans. House red wine was a nice compliment! The choices for dietary restrictions was significant. The desserts looked yummy, but we were full. Tapas style was perfect as it was not too much! It was our last night here in Edinburgh, if it was our first, we would have come back!

RMIu9aHHw9DsvyS9eARVmQ.text: Tried this place out on our first day in Edinburgh. The men running the restaurant were so nice. The food was delicious and the ambiance was quaint. Definitely worth the try!

-adWz_oKt5tP9G6PIlSVNA.text: Busy when we arrived. Calamari was horrible. Frozen then fried with thick greasy crust. Next was pasta and shrimp. It was tasteless. No garlic and chili per menu. And they put mussels in it as the shrimp were tiny. Big disappointment. Never returning and they did nothing when I complained.

ZGMvty9-nWK0LBNo53akTg.text: This place was perfect for warm food during a spout of rain. We had the spaghetti and meatballs and the salmon. Everything was perfectly cooked and very authentic. Spaghetti sauce was so good I ate the rest with a spoon. The portions were plenty. I would come back!! To top it off, the owner offered us a glass of Turkish tea before we left. It was the perfect end to the meal.

kf4eTAG4-PqjKLaF_N51wQ.text: We came here towards closing time late on a Wednesday night. The owner/host were amazing and gracious and made us feel truly welcome. We did not get drinks and ordered food directly. Paras Gratinadas was mind-blowing and I highly recommend it to anyone coming here. The Mixed Grill was awesome as well and the Iskinder. You can probably skip the Moroccan Chicpeas.

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Paras Gratinadas. Highly recommend this to anyone coming here - even if you are a meat lover
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Moroccan Chicpeas
Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Mixed Grill

4BsRla9ukCR_Z8UI52Kv8g.text: Food was just ok.  Calamari appetizer was limp, the grilled lamb was a bit tough & dry and the lemon meringue pie was weirdly goopy.

aD4IiHb_PUPmADf3y20MTQ.text: Conveniently located along Rose Street, this is a very good Mediterranean restaurant.  It is quite cozy with only a handful of tables, so a reservation is advisable.  There are many small plates and several entrees to house from.  Standouts are the lamb meatballs, red pepper dip, and the grilled chicken dish.  The service is great and this place is definitely worth checking out!

gee5NM1rd5szfkojK_J34Q.text: We had a great time at Zara's, from the moment we arrived until the very end. Staff is friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. We had the lentil soup, the tzatziki, the hummus, and the sauteed chicken with mozzarella and a red sauce. Every dish was tastefully prepared and delicious right down to the garnish, and the staff were kind enough to accommodate our special request. I especially appreciate that the kitchen shows restraint in the ingredients they use; no dish had too much of a seasoning or too little, so it is clear that they are not hiding behind their sauces or garnishes. The atmosphere and location are enjoyable as well - a lively scene without it being too loud or obnoxious, and it was a pleasure to sit out on the little patio. We dined at an off peak hour, so we were able to be seated right away and did not experience any undue delays at any point during the experience. I would definitely dine here again in the future if I am fortunate enough to visit Edinburgh a second time.

70k6lLbJCs72You_YOgKWQ.text: Happened on this fantastic little Bistro with amazing service and great food, had the mushrooms with spicy sausage and cheese, great combination of spices and flavor followed by the nightly special, salmon perfectly cooked with cherry tomatoes and new potatoes on a bed of spring mix. Nothing rushed, food served hot, great service.

photos.caption: Photo of Zara's Mediterranean Bistro - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

FyL3SkHgV1stDwLinqtccw.text: Popped in here for dinner on a whim as Sarah had a voucher. We called to check they could accommodate two in the 30 mins it would take us to walk there and they said no problem.  The restaurant is quite small, so we had to mill around just inside the door while they got a table set up. There seemed to be some confusion about where they wanted to seat us. We were given menus straight away after we were seated and they explained that seafood & steak would incur a surcharge. All fine.  It's quite a large menu and many things looked good, so it took us quite some time to decide, although they seemed in no hurry to take our order. Once we got their attention and put in our order, it took a while for our wines to be brought over though our starters followed pretty soon after. We also got a basket of pita bread for snacking on.  There was a good break between our plates being cleared and our mains arriving. I went for one of their signature dishes, essentially a lamb stew, it was served with a side of rice and some salad. My chicken wings and main were both really tasty, and although the portions felt a little small, I didn't leave hungry, so can't really complain. I could definitely have fit in dessert, although there wasn't any on the menu (that I remember) and we weren't offered a dessert menu (but we also didn't ask for one).  The tables are very close together, so I had to squeeze myself past two guys having their dinner to leave. The decor is quite strange, retro coca cola ad posters and Turkish lamps!  All in all, the food was good. Especially good value on a voucher. Service was a bit patchy, we also had to ask for water. I'd happily pop back for a casual dinner if I was around Rose Street though probably wouldn't make a point of going especially.
